task: Concatenate all .MF4 files in the folder C:\Users\ADMIN\Downloads\ev-data-pack-v10\ev-data-pack-v10\electric_cars\log_files\Kia EV6\LOG\2F6913DB\00001026\.Save the concatenated file as Kia_EV_6_2F6913DB.mf4 in the same folder.

plan.reasoning: Activate the asammdf application to ensure subsequent UI interactions target the correct window
Capture current UI elements before starting (required by workflow rules)
Open the Mode menu to switch to Batch processing (KB describes switching mode before batch operations)
Refresh UI state to reveal the Mode menu options before selecting Batch processing
Select Batch processing mode so multiple files can be processed/concatenated (KB: set_mode_batch_processing)
Confirm the UI switched to Batch processing and reveal batch controls before adding files
Open the File menu to use Open (KB open_files describes File → Open for loading files into batch mode)
Capture File menu options to select Open
Choose Open to bring up the file dialog for selecting the .MF4 files (KB: open_files)
Wait for and capture the file open dialog UI elements (required before typing into the File name field)
Navigate the file dialog to the exact folder containing all .MF4 files (follow KB guidance to enter folder path in file dialog)
Allow the file dialog to navigate to the specified folder and list files
Capture the file list in the target folder so we can select one .MF4 file (required before selection)
Select any single .MF4 file in the folder as the anchor selection (KB learning: select one file first, then Ctrl+A to select all)
Select all .MF4 files in the folder (KB learning: after selecting one MF4, press Ctrl+A to highlight all files)
Confirm that all .MF4 files are selected in the dialog before opening them into the batch list
Load the selected .MF4 files into asammdf (KB: open_files Open button to confirm selection and load)
Allow asammdf time to load the selected files into the Batch processing file list
Capture the Batch processing view and file list now that files are loaded (required before choosing operation)

Select the Concatenate operation to merge the loaded MF4 files into one continuous measurement (KB: batch_concatenate_files). Note: previous failures reported multiple Concatenate controls; choose the operation control shown in Batch processing view (lower/operation area).
Ensure any operation-specific options (e.g., sync by timestamp) and the output filename field are visible before entering the output name
Focus the output filename edit so we can type the desired output path and name (KB: batch_concatenate_files expects entering an output filename)
Enter the full output path and filename for the concatenated MF4 (KB: batch_concatenate_files requires entering the output filename). Using same folder as inputs as requested.
Verify the output filename field contains the correct path before starting the operation
Start the concatenation by clicking Save (KB learning: the correct final action is Save, not Start, to begin the batch concatenation)
Allow time for the concatenation process to run and the output file to be created (duration depends on file sizes; increase if needed)
Confirm completion and presence of the newly created file in the Batch processing output area or via UI status messages

Switch to Batch processing mode, load all .MF4 files from the exact folder (by entering the folder path, selecting one file, then Ctrl+A to select all — a reliable approach from past learnings), choose the Concatenate operation, specify the requested output filename in the same folder, and click Save to perform the concatenation. The plan follows KB-recommended sequences and incorporates past failure learnings (use File → Open + Ctrl+A to select all, choose the correct Concatenate control in batch view, and click Save rather than Start). Intermediate State-Tool calls are included before each UI interaction per workflow rules to ensure accurate element references.
